entries.title: Pro-abortion rights advocates sue over state pill restrictions
entries.description: The lawsuit comes as Republican-led states in the US attempt to crack down on the use of abortion-inducing medications.

entries.title: Half Moon Bay shooting suspect faces seven murder charges
entries.description: California authorities identify six of the seven victims, as US reels from mass shootings and gun violence 'epidemic'.

entries.title: Sons of Panamanian ex-president released from US prison
entries.description: The two brothers are expected to return to Panama on Wednesday, where they and their father face corruption charges.

entries.title: US bars entry for those who ‘undermine’ Nigeria’s upcoming polls
entries.description: February 25 elections, which will determine Nigeria's president, come amid inflation and widespread insecurity.

entries.title: Taliban working on guidelines for women NGO workers: UN says
entries.description: UN aid chief Martin Griffiths met Taliban officials in a bid to push them to further relax the ban on women workers.

entries.title: ‘Rather pathetic’: Germany feels the heat after tank resistance
entries.description: German reluctance to send Leopard 2 tanks to Ukraine alleviated as US steps up with Abrams.

entries.title: Will the US default on its debt?
entries.description: The United States has hit its debt ceiling, triggering a political battle in Congress.

entries.title: Google makes changes to Android in India after antitrust setbacks
entries.description: Implementation of these changes across the ecosystem will be a 'complex process', requiring 'significant work', it said.

entries.title: ‘Legal disgrace’: Russia shuts down its oldest human rights group
entries.description: The decision is the latest in a series of legal rulings against organisations critical of the Russian government.

entries.title: India ban on BBC Modi documentary ‘imperils press freedom’
entries.description: Media groups say Indian government is abusing its emergency powers under the 2021 IT Rules by blocking BBC documentary.

entries.title: Ukraine eyes fighter jets after tanks: ‘This is what we want’
entries.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz says there is no chance of any fighter jets being sent to Ukraine despite renewed calls.

entries.title: US school warned three times boy had gun before shooting: Lawyer
entries.description: Representative for teacher shot by student says incident could have been avoided if administrators responded sooner.

entries.title: US Feds: Investigation into Tyre Nichols’s death will ‘take time’
entries.description: Five police officers involved in the arrest were fired after an internal probe concluded they used excessive force.

entries.title: Hindenburg shorts India’s Adani citing debt, accounting concerns
entries.description: Concerns raised by the US-based short-seller sent shares of Adani Group's listed firms tumbling, eroding $11bn.

entries.title: US Secret Service report searches for parallels in mass attacks
entries.description: The first-of-its-kind report is released days after back-to-back mass shootings in California leave 18 victims dead.

entries.title: US will send dozens of Abrams tanks to Ukraine, Biden announces
entries.description: US president says the new military aid underscores Washington's 'enduring commitment' to Kyiv against Moscow's invasion.

entries.title: Bank of Canada raises rates, first major bank to signal pause
entries.description: After raising rates to highest level in 15 years, the central bank said it will hold off further increases for now.

entries.title: ECHR says it can hear case against Russia over MH17 downing
entries.description: The Netherlands and Ukraine are pursuing Moscow over its pre-February 2022 actions in eastern Ukraine.

entries.title: Clean energy race sparks more ambitious climate policies: Report
entries.description: A wave of green subsidies in the US and EU aims to boost renewable energy sources based on a 1.8C temperature rise.

entries.title: Which countries are supplying tanks to Ukraine?
entries.description: US, Germany, and UK have pledged to provide advanced battle tanks to Kyiv - a move Russia called 'extremely dangerous'.

entries.title: Lebanon’s top prosecutor charges Beirut blast Judge Tarek Bitar
entries.description: The prosecutor also ordered the release of all suspects detained in connection with the deadly 2020 Beirut blast.

entries.title: Mauritanian ex-president in court for landmark corruption trial
entries.description: The prosecution of a former leader is unprecedented in Mauritania and extremely rare in Africa.

entries.title: Democracy ‘backsliding’ has slowed Africa’s development: study
entries.description: The Mo Ibrahim Foundation has been tracking the quality of leadership and democracy on the continent since 2007.

entries.title: US man released after 25 years in prison amid new evidence
entries.description: Judge ordered Albert 'Ian' Schweitzer 'released from shackles immediately' during proceedings in Hawaii court.

entries.title: Iran blacklists more European officials as tensions rise
entries.description: Foreign ministry in Tehran blacklists three entities and 22 people from the EU, a think tank and eight officials in UK.

entries.title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian man in ‘attempted stabbing’
entries.description: Aref Abdel Nasser Lahlouh, 20, was shot dead near Qalqilya in the northern occupied West Bank.

entries.title: Haiti’s sexual violence survivors demand justice
entries.description: Sexual violence is surging in Haiti amid widespread insecurity, advocates say, but impunity 'remains the norm'.

entries.title: Russia scorns Germany for sending Leopard battle tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: Germany's move to deliver Leopard 2s to Kyiv will lead to 'permanent escalation', says Russian embassy in Berlin.

entries.title: Tanzania opposition leader Lissu returns from exile
entries.description: His return follows President Hassan's announcement this month of the end of a ban on political gatherings in Tanzania.

entries.title: Abrams and Leopard tanks: Why are they important to Ukraine?
entries.description: Kyiv has long called on Western nations to send battle tanks, arguing they are essential for battlefield success.

entries.title: Two British volunteers confirmed dead in eastern Ukraine
entries.description: The men were attempting a humanitarian evacuation from the town of Soledar when they were killed, their families say.

entries.title: Why Modi doesn’t want India to watch BBC film on Gujarat carnage
entries.description: India has used emergency powers to block the airing of the documentary that questions Modi's role in the 2002 riots.

entries.title: What does Israel’s new government mean for Palestinians?
entries.description: Benjamin Netanyahu’s ultranationalist and ultraorthodox government has Palestinians and rights advocates raising alarm.

entries.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 336
entries.description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 336th day, we take a look at the main developments.

entries.title: 18 missing, 4 rescued after cargo ship sinks off southwest Japan
entries.description: Search and rescue efforts are under way after a cargo ship carrying lumber capsizes between Japan and South Korea.

entries.title: Five-day COVID-19 lockdown imposed in Pyongyang
entries.description: Reports of North Koreans panic-buying food ahead of lockdown triggered by rising cases of respiratory illnesses.

entries.title: Mongolia pledges to clean up coal trade with China after protests
entries.description: Mongolia's government will auction coal on the stock exchange after scandal involving underground coal sales.

entries.title: Fears of escalation after Myanmar air raids near India border
entries.description: Five people were killed in the attacks, which struck the headquarters of the Chin National Front, an ethnic armed group.

entries.title: Hipkins sworn in as New Zealand PM as Ardern bows out
entries.description: The 44-year-old faces an uphill battle to lead the Labour Party to victory in October's election.

entries.title: Effort to eradicate Guinea worm disease enters ‘last mile’
entries.description: The final years of the eradication effort, led by the US's Carter Center, will be the 'most difficult', expert says.

entries.title: Storm brings tornado damage to Gulf Coast region of Texas
entries.description: About 123,000 people were left without power in the aftermath of a large storm in the southern United States on Tuesday.

entries.title: As deadly protests continue, Peru’s government faces crisis
entries.description: Analysts warn that violent tactics used to repress protests under President Dina Boluarte will lead to further unrest.
